definition: Internet Protocol (IP) is the principal communications protocol in the Internet protocol suite for relaying datagrams across network boundaries.

claims.claim: IP provides connectionless, unreliable packet delivery service
IPv4 uses 32-bit addresses while IPv6 uses 128-bit addresses
IP operates at the network layer (Layer 3) of the OSI model

a1b2c3d4e5f6789012345678901234567890abcd.content: The Internet Protocol is designed for use in interconnected systems of packet-switched computer communication networks.

b2c3d4e5f6789012345678901234567890abcdef.content: IPv4 addresses are 32 bits long and are typically written as four octets separated by dots.

c3d4e5f6789012345678901234567890abcdef12.content: The Internet Protocol is the network layer protocol in the Internet protocol suite.
